page.title: 01Weston Under Redcastle
page.content: To the north is an escarpmment of red sand stone containing caves, a red sand stone castle and a folly (a tower). These hills look south to Hawkstone Hotel and golf course this was the home of Sandy Lyle (British Open Golf Champion 1985) To the west is the hamlet of Weston under Redcastlle, with its delightful little church with a tower, and outside are the village stocks. The road from Wem to Hodnet runs along the bottom of the valley, past Menagerie pool in the north east is the hill top hamlet of Marchamley from where Liverpool and Manchester may be seen. Hawkstone Park was the home of the Hill family and now houses a Roman Catholic retreat and education centre Farming (arable) is the main occupation.
